text.section: A person who has been convicted of a felony and is actually serving a court-ordered sentence of imprisonment, including any term of parole or probation, for the conviction, and has been rendered ineligible to vote pursuant to § 3-102(b) of this article, may not vote or attempt to vote during the time that the person is rendered ineligible to vote.
A person who violates this section is guilty of a felony and is subject to imprisonment for not less than 1 year nor more than 5 years.
